title: If You Wrote a Novel Based On a Champion? Who Would Have the Best One?
body:
I believe the honor of this would go to Kindred. It's a creative story, when you have 2 spirits who relentlessly haunt you, when you don't know what or where they are. It's also more likely to have perfect word placement, due to how elegant Lamb is. You'll never be bored, when you get a mix of action, heartbreak, and suspense from the novel "Masks of the Kindred"

Make it Riot?

Ryze is a powerful mage further empowered by the world rune he collects causing rune energies to flow through his body. He is constantly searching, never stopping, and due to the Rune's nature he must keep going. To keep them safe, to save the world from itself Ryze has committed himself solelyto securing the world Runes of Runeterra which are magical devices capable of Cataclysmic catastrophes. But to secure them, Ryze has to undergo various trials and somewhere in the darkness where he ventures a presumed entity is searching for him. 

Viktor seems like a rather complex character due to his original moral driven intents before him being highly discredited for his work and his work later used to create monstrosities such as {{champion:6}}.  Viktor set to his goal of improving humanity and chose to undergo significant cybernetic modifications to point you would no longer recognise the man underneath. He has presumably to a degree removed his capacity feel emotions and now seeks to change the world for his "glorious evolution" to which he deems the future of all mankind.

Yorick is isolated with the only beings he ever contacted being the lost souls forming the mist which makes up his cloak as he ventures in the shadow isles biding his time to defeat the Ruined King in the name of the undead and all the souls that ever suffered due to the shadow isles. He believes he can lift this curse and though his methods are sometimes cruel and sadistic it is through these methods that the shadow Isles will be brought to. 

Jhin is a complex sociopath driven by his desire to perfection, it wouldn't necessarily be a novel about Jhin but who would be his protoganist exploring a world created by Jhin and his twisted vision, uncovering all the crime scenes, narrowly escaping death and exploring the Virtuosos background to uncover his dark history.
